title.narrative: Public Sector Reform for Results Project

description.narrative: The objective of the project is to improve efficiency and accountability in the delivery of selected services by Selected Entities.

Office of the Senior Presidential Advisor

condition.narrative: In implementing Part 1.3 of the Project, the Recipient shall:(a) ensure that at all times during the implementation of theProject, each reimbursement made in connection with the EEPs pertaining to CHRAJ is solely made for the delivery of CHRAJ’sAdministrative Justice functions; and (b) carry out as part of its annual audit for the Project, an audit covering said EEPs, inform and substance satisfactory to the Association.

In implementing Part 2.2 of the Project, the Recipient shall through NITA: (i) enter into a Service Level Agreement with eachSelected Entity which shall inter alia provide for the specified services to be provided by NITA and the applicable standards,including timelines and quality; providing a help desk for trouble-shooting; enhancements to Selected Entities’ websites anddeveloping and implementing mobile and web-based applications for improving service delivery; quality control and compliance withNITA standards and protocols, tracking the status of service requests, and registering and tracking complaints from service users;and (ii) exercise its rights and carry out its obligations under the SLA in such manner as to protect its interest and those of theAssociation and to accomplish the purposes of the Project, and, except as the Association shall otherwise agree, the Recipientshall not assign, amend, abrogate or waive any SLA or any provision thereof.

The PStC shall be chaired by the Senior Minister or his representative, or any other person appointed by the Office of thePresident acceptable to the Association; and shall be responsible for: (i) providing overall policy and strategic oversight anddirection on project implementation; (ii) approving Annual Work Plans and Budgets; (iii) reviewing Project progress and achievementof results including DLIs achievement; (iv) holding semi-annual public meetings where Selected Entities will each submit a reporton their progress and results, and their implementation plans for the next six months; (v) publishing each such written report,along with a video recording of the meeting, on the OSM website and require the IVA to verify the achievement of results stated ineach such report; and (vi) convening meetings at least twice a year to review overall Project achievements and results.

The Recipient shall ensure that: (a) all consultancies related to technical assistance, design and capacity building under theProject, the application of whose results could have environmental, social, health or safety implications, shall only be undertakenpursuant to terms of reference reviewed and found satisfactory by the Association; and (b) such terms of reference shall requirethe technical assistance, design and capacity-building activities to take into account the requirements of the applicableAssociation Safeguards Policies and EHS Guidelines.

The Recipient shall establish and thereafter maintain, throughout the implementation of the Project, a Project Steering Committee(PStC) with composition (including representatives of at least three civil society/non-governmental organizations), resources andterms of reference all acceptable to the Association.
The Recipient shall furnish to the Association each Project Report not later than forty-five (45) days after the end of eachcalendar quarter, covering the calendar quarter.

The Recipient shall prepare a Project Operational Manual (POM) in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, containingdetailed arrangements and procedures for implementation of the Project including inter alia: (a) disbursement and flow of fundsarrangements; (b) institutional arrangements; (c) financial management, governance and procurement systems; (d) monitoring andevaluation, reporting and communication, including indicators; (e) detailed arrangements for verification of achievement of theDLRs (including the Verification Protocol); and (f) such other administrative, financial, technical and organizational arrangementsand procedures as shall be required for the Project.

The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association not later than November 30 of each Fiscal Year (FY) or any other dateagreed with the Association during the implementation of the Project, a work plan and budget containing all activities proposed tobe included in the Project during the following FY, and a proposed financing plan for expenditures required for such activities,setting forth the proposed amounts and sources of financing.

The Recipient shall: (i) appoint and thereafter maintain, at all times during the implementation of the Project, the IVA underterms of reference acceptable to the Association to verify the data and other evidence supporting the achievement of one or moreDLIs as set forth in the table in Annex 1 of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement and recommend corresponding payments to be made,as applicable; and (ii) ensure that the IVA (A) carries out verification in accordance with the Verification Protocol; and (B)submits to the Association the corresponding verification reports in a timely manner and in form and substance satisfactory to theAssociation.

The Recipient through OSM shall, not later than 3 months from the Effectiveness Date, establish and thereafter maintain throughoutimplementation of the Project, a PIT in each Selected Entity, with terms of reference, staffing and resources acceptable to theAssociation.

The Recipient through the OSM shall, not later than 3 months from the Effectiveness Date, establish and thereafter maintainthroughout the implementation of the Project, a Project Technical Committee (PTC) with a composition, mandate, terms of referenceand resources satisfactory to the Association. The PTC shall be chaired by the Project Coordinator, and shall include, inter alia,representatives from the Selected Entities involved in Project implementation.

The Recipient through the Office of the Senior Minister (OSM) shall establish within OSM and thereafter maintain, at all timesduring the implementation of the Project, a Project Management Unit (PMU), with functions, staffing and resources satisfactory tothe Association for the purpose of ensuring prompt and efficient overall coordination, day to day implementation of, andcommunications and public outreach relating to Project activities and results. To this end, the Recipient shall appoint staff(including, inter alia, a Project Coordinator), with qualifications, experience and terms of reference acceptable to theAssociation.

title.narrative: BDR: Deaths registered within 3 months of the event
EPA: Individuals and micro, small, medium enterprises (MSMEs) issued EPA permits within specified period
Annual conduct of Citizen Assessment Survey (Listen to Ghana) and publication of results
Passport Office: Regular-service passport applicants issued passport within 21 working days of application, each calendar year
Complaints received by the third-party project-level complaint handling entity and Selected Entities, of which resolved within specified times
BDR: Births registered within 3 months of the event
DLI independent verification agent reports submitted on a semi-annual basis
Selected Entities that publish data semi-annually on number of complaints received, resolved and pending
Women service users provided selected services within the prescribed time limits published in Client Service Charters/Service Standards updated under PSRRP
Service users provided selected services within the prescribed time limits published in Client Service Charters (CSCs)/Client Service Standards (CSS) updated under PSRRP
Monitoring and Evaluation Units in Selected Entities, collecting data and monitoring annual performance targets
Complaints about administrative services filed in the CHRAJ by service users, which are resolved within the stipulated timeline
Time to deliver selected services by Selected Entities, illustrated by time taken to register a vehicle
Client Service Charters (CSC)/Client Service Standards (CSS) are updated and published on the Selected Entities’ websites

baseline.value: Client Service Charters CSCs and CSS have not been updated and published

target.value: At least 7 Selected Entities publish updated CSCs/ CSS on their websites

actual.value: In process. Consults to be hired for technical assistance to PSC and OHCS for updating standard templates/ formats for CSCs/ CSS.

title.narrative: Complaints received by independent Third-Party Project-level Complaint Handling Entity, and Selected Entities, of which resolved within specified times

baseline.value: Independent Third-Party Project-Level Complaint Handling Entity has not been contracted

target.value: At least 7 Selected Entities resolve beneficiary complaints within specified times

actual.value: No progress. Consultant still to be procured.

title.narrative: Prepare and implement a Gender Strategy and Action Plan applicable to all entities under the PSC and OHCS and train Selected Entities to implement it

baseline.value: No Gender Strategy and Action Plan prepared

target.value: At least 7 Selected Entities begin to implement their Gender Strategy and Action Plan, as evidenced by stakeholder consultation andreporting on progress

actual.value: In process. TOR and cost of assignment submitted to and approved by World Bank. PMU in the process of advertising to procure aconsultant for the assignment.

title.narrative: Semi-annual public meetings held by the Office of the Senior Minister

baseline.value: No public meetings have been held semi-annually

target.value: Semi-annual public meetings have been held, written reports and videos posted on OSM website

title.narrative: BDR takes measures to meet the targeted number of births registered within 3 months of the event

target.value: Non-cash modes of payment for BDR services are fully operational

actual.value: BDR has finalized and submitted the Strategy and Action Plan to increase access to BDR services and the Vehicle Deployment Strategyto PMU. Awaiting verification by IVA.

title.narrative: EPA takes measures for environmental permit issuance and renewal, and complaints handling for individuals and MSMEs

target.value: Online and mobile application-based environmental permit system for individuals and MSMEs is fully operational.

actual.value: EPA has submitted the revised TORs for online and mobile application.

title.narrative: DVLA takes measures for driver licensing and vehicle registration

target.value: At least 7 regional offices streamline vehicle inspection and registration process

actual.value: Strategy and Action Plan for the rolling out of the Electronic Vehicle Registration System (EVRS) to reduce time for registrationof vehicles from six (6) hours to one (1) hour has been developed. Achievement of this DLI to be verified.

title.narrative: MFA&RI: PSRRP-financed Asset Register functioning according to specifications
MLGRD: Inspectorate Division for MMDAs is receiving MMDA revenue and expenditure data and financial statements
MoT: Transport Sector Data Management System is fully operational and meeting system performance benchmarks
PSC and OHCS publish updated templates and formats for Client Service Charters (CSC)/Client Service Standards (CSS) applicable to Selected Entities on their websites
Service Level Agreements (SLAs) signed between NITA and relevant Selected Entities

baseline.value: Selected Entities have not signed SLAs with NITA

target.value: At least 7 Selected Entities have signed SLAs with NITA
